newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates wins Alabama contract.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates wins Alabama contract.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc said the state of Alabama had chosen it to evaluate how the millennium date change would affect information systems at 128 agencies statewide.
In a statement, the company said the state would rely on CA Discovery 2000, a software and services solution, to determine the extent of the problem and how much it would cost to fix it.

As part of the agreement, CA will dispatch a team of transition experts to Alabama to manage the impact assessment and prepare a plan by January 31, 1997. Terms were not announced. -- New York newsroom, (212) 859-1610
